text: on what should be a verdant green
hillside a desperately sad task is in
progress soldiers are looking for the
bodies of people buried in this mudslide
set off by the worst rains in 14 years
they're still finding them in this
village in the islands far south
everybody and everything has been
touched by the disaster that again that
one get I my children and my
grandchildren have lost everything
not even a pain is left everything was
destroyed
Beauregard though we live from earnings
from a small shop that was completely
destroyed by the landslide I'm appealing
for help to build a house somewhere soon
with whole tracts of land now scarred by
landslides cultivable land has been laid
waste and villagers can only watch the
Armed Forces salvage operations there
was a hitch on Monday when an Air Force
helicopter crash landed after a
technical fault but no one was hurt the
government says destroyed houses will be
rebuilt this Minister Minogue a nation
called on people whose streets have
turned to rivers including some who now
have their deceased loved ones lying in
repose at home the funeral wakes have
begun even in more built-up areas some
are stranded
thanks to generations of this family
needed rescuing by the Navy at nagura on
Monday they're being taken to safer
places at the moment the message from
the authorities is don't go home the
forecast for Tuesday is continuing heavy
rainfall and very strong winds the
cyclonic storm is due to move away from
Sri Lanka and towards Bangladesh Charles
Havilland BBC news
